result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cicely A Lebourgeois

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing rescheduled to 12-09-2022 at 10:00 am, Branch 30.

Defendant Cicely A Lebourgeois in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Cicely A Lebourgeois.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 3 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if she is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNT 4  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 30 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Cicely A Lebourgeois in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Monica Shawna Dixon appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned for in-person hearing, Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Cicely A Lebourgeois in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cicely A Lebourgeois appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery but needs an offer and requests an adjournment. Case remains calendared in Br 30. 
  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with all Macy's stores in Milwaukee County.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/22/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Cicely A Lebourgeois in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Cicely A Lebourgeois not in court.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/22 @ 1:30p
